alert.note: Alert for Marin (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 10 at 2:07PM PST until March 10 at 5:45PM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: .River and creek levels will remain elevated this afternoon. This includes the Lagunitas Creek. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following counties, Marin and Sonoma. * WHEN...Until 700 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on creeks. This includes the Lagunitas Creek. Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 204 PM PST, Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Rafael, Novato, Mill Valley, San Anselmo, Larkspur, Corte Madera, Tiburon, Fairfax, Sausalito, San Geronimo, Lucas Valley-Marinwood, Point Reyes Station, Black Point-Green Point, Stinson Beach, Kentfield, Muir Beach, Tamalpais- Homestead, Tamalpais-Homestead Valley, Strawberry and Tomales. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
